thread.title: Dos Santos brothers, injured doubts included in Mexico side to face U.S.
thread.title_full: Dos Santos brothers, injured doubts included in Mexico side to face U.S.

author: Shooter who killed 9 at Oregon college identified
title: Dos Santos brothers, injured doubts included in Mexico side to face U.S.
text:
Dos Santos brothers, injured doubts included in Mexico side to face U.S. Goal.com 14 hrs ago Â© Provided by Goal.com Mexico has released its roster for an Oct. 10 playoff with the United States.
AdChoices The match, pitting the 2015 Gold Cup winner against that tournament's 2013 champion, will decide which team earns CONCACAF's spot in the 2017 Confederations Cup.
After missing September friendly matches against Trinidad and Tobago and Argentina, Giovani dos Santos of the LA Galaxy and his brother Villarreal's Jonathan dos Santos return to the fold. Malaga goalkeeper Guillermo Ochoa also missed those matches, but despite being named to the provisional roster does not appear in the final call.
The list released by the Mexican federation on social media reports interim El Tri manager Ricardo 'Tuca" Ferretti has called 25 players, with questions lingering about the status of Andres Guardado, who injured his ankle in a Champions League match in mid-September, and Rafa Marquez, who had an adductor problem that has kept him out of club action. It is not clear if Mexico submitted 25 names to CONCACAF, with the roster limit capped at 23 names.
Among the names are four players from the club side Ferretti manages, Tigres, and three players each from Portugese side Porto and reigning CONCACAF Champions League champion Cub America.
Full roster:
Goalkeepers: Moises Munoz (America), Alfredo Talavera (Toluca), Jonathan Orozco (Monterrey)
Defenders: Paul Aguilar (America), Diego Reyes (Real Sociedad), Rafa Marquez (Hellas Verona), Hector Moreno (PSV), Miguel Layun (Porto), Arturo Rivas (Tigres), Jorge Torres Nilo (Tigres), Israel Jimenez (Tigres), Miguel Herrera (Pachuca)
Midfielders: Hector Herrera (Porto), Andres Guardado (PSV), Jose Juan Vazquez (Leon), Javier Aquino (Tigres), Jonathan dos Santos (Villarreal), Carlos Pena (Leon), Jesus "Tecatito" Corona (Porto), Carlos Esquivel (Toluca)
Forwards: Oribe Peralta (America), Raul Jimenez (Benfica), Javier Hernandez (Bayer Leverkusen), Carlos Vela (Real Sociedad)
